title: Sauteed Red and White Cabbage
summary: Sauteed Red and White Cabbage might be just the side dish you are searching for. This gluten free and primal recipe serves 12 and costs 60 cents per serving. One serving contains 136 calories, 4g of protein, and 11g of fat. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have bacon, salt, cabbage, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. With a spoonacular score of 28%, this dish is not so outstanding. Try Spiralized Red Cabbage Kohlrabi Slaw with Cilantro Vinaigrette, Sauteed Cabbage, and Sauteed Cabbage for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Halve the cabbages and core them. Slice into thin strips. In two separate pots of boiling water, blanch each type of cabbage for 5 seconds and drain immediately.                                                    In a large skillet, render the bacon until golden brown.Drain the bacon on paper towels, and reserve. Add the cabbage to the skillet and cook, tossing over moderate heat, to coat it with the rendered fat.Add the caraway seeds. Fold in the sour cream and season to taste. Toss and cook until the cabbage is tender. Fold in the bacon pieces and serve.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Halve the cabbages and core them. Slice into thin strips. In two separate pots of boiling water, blanch each type of cabbage for 5 seconds and drain immediately.
In a large skillet, render the bacon until golden brown.
Drain the bacon on paper towels, and reserve.
Add the cabbage to the skillet and cook, tossing over moderate heat, to coat it with the rendered fat.
Add the caraway seeds. Fold in the sour cream and season to taste. Toss and cook until the cabbage is tender. Fold in the bacon pieces and serve.
